newsitem.title: USA: USCS says signs contact with Cox.
newsitem.headline: USCS says signs contact with Cox.

text.p: USCS International Inc said Monday its International Billing Services unit signed a five-year contract to provide statement processing services for Cox Communications Inc's new telephony business.
The company did not disclose the value of the contract.

Under this agreement, the USCS unit will produce its IBS BookBill for customers of Cox's new telephony service. The BookBill is a statement format that consolidates four pages of separate account information onto a single sheet.
USCS said the unit currently produces statements for the many of Cox's cable television customers.
Using its broadband network, Cox is launching residential wireline telephone service to its largest markets.
As provider of local telephone service, Cox will be adding to telecommunications products that include video programming, high-speed Internet access, long distance and wireless phone service.

USCS's BookBill reduces the amount of paper used per statement, cutting both materials costs and postage costs. It said savings can be "significant" for companies with high volume, multi-page statement processing needs.
